page.title: 20COMMUNITY POLICING
page.content: In northern Hoddesdon P.C.White is the{community policeman.}His role reflects a change in policy by the Chief Constable of Hertfordshire to one where the police get out into the community. P.C. White tries to involve himself with young people by visiting discos and youth groups. He also runs county designed courses aimed at primary school pupils which try to introduce children to the work of the police through first hand involvement. The course includes talks, videos and role playing by the children on such topics as the history of the police, communications, dog handling and water safety. The course concludes with a full scale tour of Hertford Police Station, during which the children see the police cells and vehicles.
